general.name: Allan Dantas
general.title: Software Engineering Student
general.bio: Hi! I'm Allan Dantas, a software developer.

description.about: Hello, I'm a software engineering student at 42Rio, passionate about technology and committed to developing myself as a Full Stack programmer.

navigation.commands: Available commands: help, about, skills, projects, clear

skills.techIntro: This section is to talk about my technical skills.
skills.hardTechnical: At École 42, I developed strong skills in C/C++ programming, efficient algorithms, operating systems like Unix/Linux, networking and protocols, and web development using modern frameworks. These hard skills enable me to solve complex problems and collaborate in development teams.
skills.hardExperience: In addition to my studies at École 42, I have gained practical experience working at 42labs. This experience has allowed me to apply my technical skills in real-world projects, further enhancing my abilities in software development, debugging, and project management. Working in a collaborative environment at 42labs has also improved my communication and teamwork skills, making me a more effective and versatile developer.
skills.soft: At École 42, I've developed skills in teamwork, problem-solving, self-learning, resilience, and adaptability. These soft skills are crucial for effective collaboration, tackling challenges, and continuous professional growth.

details.startedStudyingEcole42: In September 2023, I started studying software engineering at 42Rio, an innovative and challenging programming school, where I learned C/C++, algorithms, operating systems like Unix/Linux, networking and protocols, and web development with modern frameworks.
details.workingIn42Labs: In October 2024, I started working at 42Labs, on a project for the Austral insurance company, where I applied my technical knowledge to real projects, had the opportunity to work with technologies like Dagster, Python, Docker, Great expectations, among others.
details.workingInCI&T: In  2025, I started working at CI&T, a global technology and digital solutions company, where I continue to develop my technical skills and collaborate on challenging projects.

fdf.title: Fdf - Fil de Fer
fdf.description: This project consists of graphically creating a schematic representation of a terrain in relief.
fdf.description1: FdF is a project in which we convert a file with a grid of height values into a 3D wireframe using a simple graphics library called MiniLibX.
fdf.description2: The rows of the grid represent the x-axis, the columns the y-axis, and the values the z-axis (altitude), creating a 3D wireframe representation.

philo.title: Philosophers
philo.description: The famous Dining Philosophers problem, all with the same basic rules.
philo.description1: This project is a training to multi-threads/multi-process programming with the use of mutex and semaphore. It contains 3 different programs simulating a twist of the famous Dining Philosophers problem, all with the same basic rules.
philo.description2: This project helps to understand the basics of functions in C. Great for improving knowledge in memory allocation and programming logic.

push-swap.title: Push Swap
push-swap.description: A project that involves sorting a list of integers using a limited set of operations.
push-swap.description1: The goal of the push_swap project is to sort a stack of integers using two stacks and a specific set of operations.
push-swap.description2: Stacks: The project involves two stacks, Stack A and Stack B, initially containing a random set of integers.
push-swap.description3: Operations: Students are required to implement a set of operations to manipulate the stacks.
push-swap.description4: Sorting Algorithm: The main challenge is to devise an algorithm that uses these operations to sort Stack A in ascending order.
push-swap.description5: Constraints: The project typically imposes constraints on the number of operations allowed, aiming for an efficient and optimized sorting algorithm.

minishell.title: Minishell
minishell.description: This project is about creating a simple shell. Yes, a little bash.
minishell.description1: Minishell is a project focused on creating a simple, minimalistic shell interface.
minishell.description2: It demonstrates basic command-line functionalities and a lightweight environment for user commands.
